questions.question_text:
A salesperson is viewing a My Activities list as a calendar.
The salesperson wants to change the status of a phone call by dragging an activity to a new status.
You need to ensure that the salesperson can switch their view type.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - add Kanban control, as only Kanban allows drag and drop to new status, Calendar control doesn't. Not A, as question asks what you as admin needs to do, not what user needs to do. Not C, as you can have both Kanban and Calendar controls at the same time

The option D. Add the Kanban control to the view is not the correct answer because the Kanban control is already available in Dynamics 365 Sales. The Kanban control is added to the Activity entity by default. Therefore, there’s no need to add the Kanban control to the view.

The salesperson can switch their view type to Kanban by selecting the More commands icon on the command bar, then selecting Show As, and finally choosing Kanban. This allows the salesperson to visually represent their sales activities in their different states and they can drag them to move from one status to another.

So, the correct answer is A. Select Show As in the ribbon. This allows the salesperson to switch their view type to Kanban without needing to add the Kanban control to the view.

Selected Answer: D
D

You need to ensure that the salesperson can switch their view type = add Kanban

comments.content:
- You need to have more that one control for the 'show as' button to show.
- If you have another control that is not Kanban, you cannot perform that action
- So you need to add the Kanban control first

discussion.content: This is A because this question is specifically asking about "Show As" NOT that the control needs to be added.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

choices.B: Select Create View in the ribbon.
choices.A: Select Show As in the ribbon.
choices.C: Remove the Calendar control, and then add the Kanban control to the view.
choices.D: Add the Kanban control to the view.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales. You qualify a lead record.
Which record is created when you quality a lead? To answer, drag the appropriate record types to the correct leads. Each record type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

HOTSPOT -
A company uses Dynamics 365 Sales to track activities. The sales department plans to use leads.
You need to determine:
✑ Which activities convert to leads.
✑ Which field carries over from the activity to the lead.
Which feature should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct! Email can be converted to Leads. The Subject field is carried over to the Opportunity

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A salesperson progresses through the Lead to Opportunity sales process.
//IMG//

You need to identify what needs to be completed to enter the next stage.
Which action should you perform to advance the business process to each subsequent stage? To answer, drag the appropriate actions to the correct stages. Each action may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content: I agree with you. In the propose phase i wanted to use the option "Associate a quote to the lead". But that doesn't make sense since on that stage it is an oppty already (not a lead anymore).
It makes sense because a business process flow can track across multiple tables.

discussion.content: Actually, testing, you can move to the text stage by completing all required fields and hitting next in any of these options. Only in the Qualify Stage you could also hit the "Qualify" button, so I would answer 1: Qualify the lead, 2: Complete all required fields, 3: Complete all required fields

1. Qualify the lead
2. Complete the required fields.
3. Complete the required fields.
Correct answer but questions has been poorly worded

I think:
Qualify: Qualify the Lead
Develop: Associate Opp to Lead (this is done automatically by Qualify so doesn't make much sense but process of elimination leaves this as the only answer?)
Propose: Complete all required fields. You don't associate Quotes to Leads so that is the odd one out, unless it is a typo and the answer was supposed to be "Associate Quote to the Opportunity"

I think, for develop, it should be complete all required fields in the stage.
from the website: 
Develop: The opportunity record is used to develop the details of the deal. Details such as the products and services they are interested in, estimated revenue, and time-lines are added to the opportunity.
More information: Create or edit an opportunity

questions.answer_description:
1. Navigate to Settings > Customization > Customize the System.
2. Expand the Entities menu.
3. Scroll down and expand Leads, then click on Fields.
4. Double click on the Status Reason field.
5. Change status to Disqualified.
6. Click Add.
7. Type in the new status reason: Cannot meet timeline for delivery
8. Click OK.
9. Click Publish All Customizations.
10.Open the lead named Brian LaMee.
11.From the command bar, click Disqualify and select the new status reason.
Reference:
https://www.azamba.com/2018/08/16/how-to-add-a-reason-to-disqualify-a-lead-in-microsoft-dynamics-365-for-sales-crm/
questions.question_text:
SIMULATION -
Please wait while the virtual machine loads. Once loaded, you may proceed to the lab section. This may take a few minutes, and the wait time will not be deducted from your overall test time.
When the Next button is available, click it to access the lab section. In this section, you will perform a set of tasks in a live environment. While most functionality will be available to you as it would be in a live environment, some functionality (e.g., copy and paste, ability to navigate to external websites) will not be possible by design.
Scoring is based on the outcome of performing the tasks stated in the lab. In other words, it doesn't matter how you accomplish the task, if you successfully perform it, you will earn credit for that task.
Labs are not timed separately, and this exam may have more than one lab that you must complete. You can use as much time as you would like to complete each lab. But, you should manage your time appropriately to ensure that you are able to complete the lab(s) and all other sections of the exam in the time provided.
Please note that once you submit your work by clicking the Next button within a lab, you will NOT be able to return to the lab.
Your company plans to generate a report to provide reasons for the disqualification of leads.
You need to add a reason of Cannot meet timeline for delivery and then apply the reason to a Sales Lead named Brian LaMee.
To complete this task, sign in to the Dynamics 365 portal.

discussion.content:
1. Vai su Impostazioni > Personalizzazione > Personalizza il sistema.
2. Espandi il menu Entità.
3. Scorri verso il basso ed espandi Lead, quindi fai clic su Campi.
4. Fare doppio clic sul campo Motivo stato.
5. Cambia lo stato in Squalificato.
6. Fare clic su Aggiungi.
7. Digitare il motivo del nuovo stato: Impossibile rispettare la tempistica di consegna.
8. Fare clic su OK.
9. Fare clic su Pubblica tutte le personalizzazioni.
10.Aprire il lead denominato Brian LaMee.
11.Dalla barra dei comandi, fare clic su Squalifica e selezionare il nuovo motivo dello stato.

Are there really labs in the exam?
]
